org.cojen.tupl.repl

Interface StreamReplicator.Reader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, DirectReplicator.Accessor, DirectReplicator.Reader
    Enclosing interface:
    StreamReplicator

    public static interface StreamReplicator.Reader
extends DirectReplicator.Reader
    Interface called by any group member for reading committed messages. Readers don't track which messages are applied — applications are responsible for tracking the highest applied index. When an application restarts, it must open the reader at an appropriate index.
    See Also:
    newReader

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default int read(byte[] buf)
      Blocks until log messages are available, never reading past a commit index or term.
      int read(byte[] buf, int offset, int length)
      Blocks until log messages are available, never reading past a commit index or term.
      default void readFully(byte[] buf, int offset, int length)
      Blocks until the buffer is fully read with messages, never reading past a commit index or term.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.cojen.tupl.repl.DirectReplicator.Accessor

        close, index, term, termEndIndex, termStartIndex

    • Method Detail

      • read

        default int read(byte[] buf)
          throws IOException
        Blocks until log messages are available, never reading past a commit index or term.
        Returns:
        amount of bytes read, or EOF (-1) if the term end has been reached
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if log was deleted (index is too low)
        IOException

      • read

        int read(byte[] buf,
         int offset,
         int length)
  throws IOException
        Blocks until log messages are available, never reading past a commit index or term.
        Returns:
        amount of bytes read, or EOF (-1) if the term end has been reached
        Throws:

      • readFully

        default void readFully(byte[] buf,
                       int offset,
                       int length)
                throws IOException
        Blocks until the buffer is fully read with messages, never reading past a commit index or term.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if log was deleted (index is too low)
        EOFException - if the term end has been reached too soon
        IOException
